headline.main: For GOP, a Fight to Define Party's Foreign Policy Posture
headline.print_headline: For GOP, a Fight to Define Party's Foreign Policy Posture

docs.snippet: For Republicans, this week's presidential debate highlighted a brewing fight to define the party's foreign policy posture. It exposed divisions about the candidates' views of America's role in fostering regime change in the Middle East and tactics...
docs.lead_paragraph: For Republicans, this week's presidential debate highlighted a brewing fight to define the party's foreign policy posture. It exposed divisions about the candidates' views of America's role in fostering regime change in the Middle East and tactics the government should use to prevent terror attacks.

headline.main: Fed Aggressively Ramps Up New Tool to Pry Rates Higher
headline.print_headline: Fed Aggressively Ramps Up New Tool to Pry Rates Higher

docs.snippet: The Federal Reserve aggressively expanded a new policy tool to help it raise U.S. interest rates from near zero, saying on Wednesday it anticipated about $2 trillion in bids for a facility to help mop up excess cash in financial markets after year...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve aggressively expanded a new policy tool to help it raise U.S. interest rates from near zero, saying on Wednesday it anticipated about $2 trillion in bids for a facility to help mop up excess cash in financial markets after years of stimulus.

headline.main: Baltimore Mayor Says City Prepared for Any Violence After Gray Mistrial
headline.print_headline: Baltimore Mayor Says City Prepared for Any Violence After Gray Mistrial

docs.snippet: The mayor of Baltimore said on Wednesday that law enforcement authorities were prepared to respond to any violent protests in the wake of the mistrial of the first of six police officers charged in the death of a black man while in custody....
docs.lead_paragraph: The mayor of Baltimore said on Wednesday that law enforcement authorities were prepared to respond to any violent protests in the wake of the mistrial of the first of six police officers charged in the death of a black man while in custody.

headline.main: Mexico Would Work With Trump but Rejects Xenophobia: Minister
headline.print_headline: Mexico Would Work With Trump but Rejects Xenophobia: Minister

docs.snippet: Mexico will work with any U.S. administration, including one headed by Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump, but firmly rejects racism and xenophobia, the country's foreign minister said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexico will work with any U.S. administration, including one headed by Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump, but firmly rejects racism and xenophobia, the country's foreign minister said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: QBs Luck, Hoyer Out as Colts Face Texans

docs.snippet: Andrew Luck went back to work Wednesday but still isn't ready to play....

headline.main: Police Called After Armed Man Spotted Near Muslim Rally
headline.print_headline: Police Called After Armed Man Spotted Near Muslim Rally

docs.snippet: Billings police officials say officers asked an armed man whose face was covered by a scarf to leave a park during a rally to support the city's small Muslim community....
docs.lead_paragraph: Billings police officials say officers asked an armed man whose face was covered by a scarf to leave a park during a rally to support the city's small Muslim community.

headline.main: Lawsuit Alleges Hazing Led to University Student's Suicide
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Alleges Hazing Led to University Student's Suicide

docs.snippet: The family of a Penn State-Altoona student who jumped to his death off the roof of a New York hotel sued the university and a suspended fraternity alleging that he killed himself because of hazing....
docs.lead_paragraph: The family of a Penn State-Altoona student who jumped to his death off the roof of a New York hotel sued the university and a suspended fraternity alleging that he killed himself because of hazing.

headline.main: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Wednesday
headline.print_headline: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Wednesday

docs.snippet: Stocks climbed Wednesday after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates, a long-expected vote of confidence in the health of the U.S. economy. The Fed emphasized that further increases will be gradual....
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks climbed Wednesday after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates, a long-expected vote of confidence in the health of the U.S. economy. The Fed emphasized that further increases will be gradual.

headline.main: AP News Guide: Why the Federal Reserve Hiked Rates
headline.print_headline: AP News Guide: Why the Federal Reserve Hiked Rates

docs.snippet: The Federal Reserve raised short-term interest rates from record lows on Wednesday. Long hinted at by Fed Chair Janet Yellen, the move signaled the beginning of the end of a period of extraordinary support for the U.S. economy in the aftermath of ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve raised short-term interest rates from record lows on Wednesday. Long hinted at by Fed Chair Janet Yellen, the move signaled the beginning of the end of a period of extraordinary support for the U.S. economy in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis.

headline.main: Economists See Next Fed Rate Increase in First Quarter of 2016-Reuters Poll
headline.print_headline: Economists See Next Fed Rate Increase in First Quarter of 2016-Reuters Poll

docs.snippet: Wall Street's top banks expect the Federal Reserve to next raise U.S. interest rates in the first quarter of next year, according to a Reuters poll conducted on Wednesday, after the Fed raised rates for the first time in more than nine years....
docs.lead_paragraph: Wall Street's top banks expect the Federal Reserve to next raise U.S. interest rates in the first quarter of next year, according to a Reuters poll conducted on Wednesday, after the Fed raised rates for the first time in more than nine years.
